name: UL GmbH
membership: UL and its subsidiaries are actively involved in international and regional associations such as but not limited to: International Federation of Inspection Agencies (IFIA);  International Confederation of Inspection and Certification Organisations (CEOC);  Confederation of British Industry (CBI); European Electrical Products Certification Association (ETICS); European Association for Medical devices of Notified Bodies (Team NB); Der Bundesverband Informationswirtschaft, Telekommunikation und neue Medien e. V. (Bitkom); European Cyber Security Organisation (ECSO); AmCham DK; Dansk Industri (DI)
goal:
Founded in 1894, UL is a global independent safety science company with more than a century of expertise innovating safety solutions. UL has earned a reputation as a global leader in product safety standards development, testing and certification. UL is guided by its Mission to promote safe working and living environments for all people, using research to continually advance and meet ever-evolving safety needs.
Around the globe, UL works to help customers, purchasers and policymakers navigate market risk and complexity. UL builds trust in the safety, security and sustainability of products, organizations, and supply chains – enabling smarter choices and better lives. In all we do, we apply science and expertise to enable the responsible design, production, marketing and purchase of the goods, solutions and innovations of today and tomorrow.
interests: Climate Action, Consumers, Customs, Digital economy and society, Energy, Environment, Food Safety, Public Health, Research and innovation, Single market, Trade
euInitiatives: UL is actively following EU initiatives related to safety: consumer product safety, market surveillance, cyber security certification, circular economy, internal market, trade negotiations
